data.title: Fix php function highlight
data.body: According to http://php.net/manual/en/functions.user-defined.php extended ascii is allowed in function name such as non breaking space ` ` (\xa0).

data.title: Add translation for Thai into Transifex VS Code projects
data.body: I want to translate Visual Code to Thai language, but it seem don't have in the language list in 4 Transifex projects. Can you add Thai language to your project?

data.title: JSDoc @deprecated tag works with a little flaw
Duplicate tasks in quick pick when there is a user defined task
"Format Selection" not working in XML files
data.body:
I have bound a shortcut key to `formatSelection`:

    {
        "key": "ctrl+l",
        "command": "editor.action.formatSelection",
        "when": "editorHasDocumentSelectionFormattingProvider && editorHasSelection && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly"
    },

(Note: I also removed the other key-chord bindings using `ctrl+l` because they were conflicting.)

This works, fine, in most languages but in XML, it does nothing. Take a look at the following code:

![2017-05-12 format selection not working in xml files](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6370145/25992013/94111822-3705-11e7-9cb6-9073cddcf2d7.PNG)

It does not fix the indentation. It does not even unify the tabs into spaces as it would in other languages - although manually invoking "*Convert Indentation to Spaces*" does work in this file.

This is a WiX file but it is correctly identified as XML - see exhibit B:

![2017-05-12 format selection not working in xml files 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6370145/25992071/c36c3570-3705-11e7-9de0-94c9ea6a9006.PNG)

Is this a known issue or bug, a new issue or bug, or simply is it the case that XML formatting is unsupported? That last case would be strange, to me, because auto indentation of XML is a pretty common feature for an IDE.

data.title: Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features.
data.body:
Title says all, NPM is in path etc

- VSCode Version:  [](https://my.mixtape.moe/wwadfq.png)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode via Start Menu or Desktop Icon
2. Receive said error

Turns out opening VSCode from Command Prompt or Powershell fixes this issue, but its a pain to have to open cmd or PS to do so.

data.title: Node2 not respecting startFrame
data.body:
Node2 seems not to be respecting [`startFrame`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugProtocol.d.ts#L622)

To be more precise if vscode sends to node2 a `stackTrace` request with `startFrame: 2` and `levels: 20` I still get back the first stack frame.
I can easily reproduce this with a simple javascript sample that does not have a deep call stack - only around 10 stack frames.

This milestone we are looking into a performance improvement to always first fetch the first callStack and in parallel fetch the rest (while the editor is already updated). Due to this I am assigning this issue to the May milestone. More details about the perf imrovement https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25605

I will probably push to insiders these call stack improvements to get coverage for other debug adapters and figure out who is not respecting it (first call stack will be shown duplicated). Also then you will be able to easily repro this.

data.title: Show "You cannot rename this element" *before* letting the user write a new name
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Version 1.13.0-insider
Commit c615b43be67170e166779c9020a249442c4f36fc
Date 2017-05-09T06:13:02.691Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

When pressing F2 to rename a variable, VSCode always lets you enter the new name, only afterwards it appears to check whether the rename is possible and if not, it shows "You cannot rename this element".

It would be better to check this first, before even prompting for a new name, to avoid frustration that what was just written has been lost and has to be written again after using Ctrl+D or similar.

data.title: Why Not Support C/C++ Semantic Analysis?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.12.1
- OS Version:Windows 10

Could you please give support to C/C++ **semantic analysis**? Regular Symbol Tree is useful in mini projects while SA is required strongly in middle or large projects. 
**Thank you!**

data.title: Syntax highlight inside HTML <script> tag is broken
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise, version 1607, OS Build: 14393.1198 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an index.html file
2. Write a `<script>` tag with attribute `type="text/x-template"` or `type="text/html"`
3. Inside `<script>` write some HTML
4. Result: 
![vscode-script-highlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1974290/25990856/8c977284-3701-11e7-9817-9fa43a57ac7c.PNG)

Note: until this build of VSCode it was working properly.

data.title: Restore hot-exit files to the correct instance when renaming workspace folder
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows7 64bit SP1 with latest update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder, and then open and modify some files ;
2. (under the setting {"files.hotExit": "onExitAndWindowClose"} ,) close the window ;
3. rename the folder (, or change its location) ;
4. open that folder with vscode ;
5. the restoring fails ;

*6. if undo the rename and/or move of the folder, everything seems to be fine again ;


So, imho maybe the archive about hotExit (or some related params (likethe current path of the folder to be restored) ) should be stored in the ./.vscode ?

data.title: Theming: introduce border colors for individual components to override contrastBorder
data.body: I wanna add a border to the right side of the sidebar. The only way to do it now that I know of is to use `contrastBorder` but that's adding a lot of other borders too which I don't want. Is it possible to do it in another way? And can you add support for it if it's not possible? Needed for https://github.com/teabyii/vscode-ayu/issues/7

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:40:39.245Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-77-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|tslint|eg2|0.14.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.2.3|
|dart|kevinplatel|0.1.0|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|2.0.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open at least two files and position the cursor on a specific line
2. switch editor by key-combination
3. move cursor => sometimes it jumps several lines beneath the original cursor position

This leads to wrong code after C&P actions.

data.title: Always Show File Names in Symbol Search Results
data.body: Fixes #26370 Updates the symbol search results to always display the filename. This feature was previously added to the TS extension specifically, so this change removes that work in favor of a change to the core symbol search experience Here's what the new results look like: Compared to the current results: Please let me know if you have any UX suggestions on where to display everything here.
